com.yantra.api.ydm

Interface manageDeliveryPlan

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YDMApi, YIFApi

    public interface manageDeliveryPlan

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document manageDeliveryPlan(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      manageDeliveryPlan is used to perform creation, modification and deletion of a delivery plan.

    • Method Detail

      • manageDeliveryPlan

        org.w3c.dom.Document manageDeliveryPlan(YFSEnvironment env,
                                        org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                 throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                        java.rmi.RemoteException

        manageDeliveryPlan is used to perform creation, modification and deletion of a delivery plan. A delivery plan comprises of load and shipments.

        This API provides the following functionality:

        • Create a new delivery plan (with or without shipments specified).
        • Modify a delivery plan which involves either addition or removal of shipments, or modification of delivery plan attributes.
        • Delete delivery plan - allow the user to delete a delivery plan only when there are no shipments in the delivery plan. However, if RemoveContentOnDelete is Y, shipments are removed from load. For more details, see the manageLoad API. and the delivery plan is deleted. In cases when shipments do not belong to any load, they are removed from the delivery plan and then the delivery plan is deleted.
        • Add a shipment that does not belong to any load to a delivery plan
        • Remove a shipment that does not belong to any load from a delivery plan

          Action Create: If DeliveryPlanNo is not specified in the input XML, it is obtained as the next number from the database sequence object SEQ_YFS_DELIVERY_PLAN_NO. If OwnerOrganizationCode is not specified, it is defaulted to EnterpriseCode of the delivery plan. Delivery plan is marked unplanned. A record is inserted into YFS_DELIVERY_PLAN table. For each shipment specified in the /DeliveryPlan/Shipments/Shipment node:

          • AssociationAction must be Add or blanks
          • Perform validations detailed in the Validation section
          • Stamp the shipment with the delivery plan key

          The transaction ID for this Action is CREATE_DELIVERY_PLAN. This transaction ID is used to raise the ON_SUCCESS event.

          Action Modify: None of the delivery plan attributes can be modified except DeliveryPlanDate, DeliveryPlanName and any other extended attributes that you may have. Planned flag on the delivery plan is determined based on the planned flag of the shipments in the delivery plan. If all shipments are planned (included in loads for every leg of the shipment from source to destination), then the delivery plan is planned, else it is marked unplanned. For each shipment specified in the /DeliveryPlan/Shipments/Shipment node the following must be true:

          • If AssociationAction is Add, perform validations listed within the Validations section. Stamp the shipment with the delivery plan key.
          • If AssociationAction is Remove, perform validations listed within the Validations section. Blank out the delivery plan key from the shipment.

          The transaction ID for this Action is MODIFY_DELIVERY_PLAN. This transaction ID is used to raise the ON_SUCCESS event.


          Action Delete: Delete of a delivery plan is allowed only if the plan does not have any shipments. However, if RemoveContentOnDelete is specified as "Y", delivery plan will be deleted in the following manner:
          1. Remove shipments from the delivery plan (key blanked out).
          2. For shipments belonging to a load, call the manageLoad() API. This API is expected to delete association between load and shipment (YFS_LOAD_SHIPMENT). The load record in YFS_LOAD is deleted along with load stops in YFS_LOAD_STOP.
          3. Eventually delete the delivery plan.

          The transaction ID for this Action is DELETE_DELIVERY_PLAN. This transaction ID is used to raise the ON_SUCCESS event.

          Related Documents
          Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

          User Exits: None

          Events Raised:
          Raised during the transaction CREATE_DELIVERY_PLAN.

            ON_SUCCESS:
              This event is raised upon successful execution of manageDeliveryPlan.
              Data published - YDM_CREATE_DELIVERY_PLAN.ON_SUCCESS.xml
              DTD - YDM_CREATE_DELIVERY_PLAN.ON_SUCCESS_dtd.txt
              Key data - deliveryPlan_dbd.txt
                Template Support: Yes

          Raised during the transaction MODIFY_DELIVERY_PLAN.
            ON_SUCCESS:
              This event is raised upon successful execution of manageDeliveryPlan.
              Data published - YDM_MODIFY_DELIVERY_PLAN.ON_SUCCESS.xml
              DTD - YDM_MODIFY_DELIVERY_PLAN.ON_SUCCESS_dtd.txt
              Key data - deliveryPlan_dbd.txt
                Template Support: Yes

          Raised during the transaction DELETE_DELIVERY_PLAN.
            ON_SUCCESS:
              This event is raised upon successful execution of manageDeliveryPlan.
              Data published - YDM_DELETE_DELIVERY_PLAN.ON_SUCCESS.xml
              DTD - YDM_DELETE_DELIVERY_PLAN.ON_SUCCESS_dtd.txt
              Key data - deliveryPlan_dbd.txt
                Template Support: Yes

          Audits: None

          Pre Conditions: None

          Post Conditions:
          Delivery Plan is created, modified or deleted. Shipments are either added to or removed from the delivery plan.

          Output Template Support: Yes

          Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains all the information about the delivery plan. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
